panels.description:
This map shows the average ICMP ping latency across different countries.

Color Scale:
ðŸŸ¢ 0-50ms: Excellent (Local/Regional)
ðŸŸ¡ 50-150ms: Good (Cross-Region)
ðŸŸ  150-300ms: Degraded (Cross-Continental)
ðŸ”´ >300ms: Poor (Requires Investigation)

Values represent:
- Average maximum latency per country
- Higher values may indicate:
  â€¢ Network congestion
  â€¢ Suboptimal routing
  â€¢ Geographic distance
  â€¢ Infrastructure limitations

Note: Hover over countries to see exact latency values. Gray countries indicate no data available.

Use this map to:
- Identify regions with latency issues
- Plan infrastructure improvements
- Monitor global network performance
- Compare performance across regions

targets.expr:
avg by(country_code) (
  last_over_time(
  icmp_ping_duration_ms{
    continent=~"$continent",
    country_code=~"$country",
    city=~"$city",
    isp=~"$isp",
    endpoint=~"$endpoint",
    ip_address=~"$ip",
    quantile="0.95"
  }[$__rate_interval])
)

panels.title: Global ICMP Latency Distribution

panels.description:
This map shows the packet delivery success rate across different countries over the selected time range, using the most recent values.

Color Scale:
ðŸŸ¢ 99.9-100%: Excellent (No packet loss)
ðŸŸ¡ 98-99.9%: Good (Minimal packet loss)
ðŸŸ  95-98%: Degraded (Moderate packet loss)
ðŸ”´ <95%: Critical (Severe packet loss)

Values represent:
- Most recent packet delivery success rate per country
- Calculated as: (last_received / last_sent) * 100
- Time Range: $__range
- Lower values indicate packet loss due to:
  â€¢ Network congestion
  â€¢ Route instability
  â€¢ Infrastructure issues
  â€¢ Network policies/firewalls

Note: 
- Hover over countries to see exact delivery rates
- Gray countries indicate no data available
- Values reflect the most recent state within the selected time window

Use this map to:
- Identify regions with packet loss
- Monitor network reliability
- Track connection stability
- Guide troubleshooting efforts
panels.title: Global Network Availability by Country

panels.description:
Shows the overall packet delivery success rate across all monitored locations.

Interpretation:
ðŸŸ¢ 99.9-100%: Excellent global reliability
ðŸŸ¡ 98-99.9%: Good, but room for improvement
ðŸŸ  95-98%: Requires attention
ðŸ”´ <95%: Critical global issues

Calculation:
- Total packets received / Total packets sent
- Aggregated across all regions
- Using most recent values
- Time Range: $__range

Use this metric to:
- Monitor overall network health
- Track global SLA compliance
- Identify systemic issues
- Guide global infrastructure decisions
panels.title: Global Network Availability

panels.description:
Shows the average ICMP ping latency across all monitored locations globally.

Interpretation:
ðŸŸ¢ 0-50ms: Excellent global performance
ðŸŸ¡ 50-100ms: Good performance
ðŸŸ  100-200ms: Requires investigation
ðŸ”´ >200ms: Critical performance issues

Calculation:
- Average of all ping latencies
- Aggregated across all regions
- Using most recent values
- Time Range: $__range

Factors affecting latency:
- Geographic distance
- Network congestion
- Routing efficiency
- Infrastructure quality
- Cross-continental links

Use this metric to:
- Monitor global network performance
- Identify systemic slowdowns
- Track performance trends
- Guide optimization efforts
panels.title: Global Average Latency

panels.description: Shows latency values with anomaly detection (>50% increase from 1h ago)
panels.title: Latency Anomalies

panels.description:
Shows average ICMP ping latency broken down by continent, highlighting regional performance variations.

Color Scale:
ðŸŸ¢ 0-50ms: Excellent (Local/Regional)
ðŸŸ¡ 50-150ms: Good (Cross-Region)
ðŸŸ  150-300ms: Degraded (Cross-Continental)
ðŸ”´ >300ms: Poor (Requires Investigation)

Calculation:
- Average of ping latencies per continent
- Using most recent values
- Time Range: $__range

Expected patterns:
- NA/EU: Generally lowest latency
- AS/OC: May show higher latency
- SA/AF: Could show highest latency due to infrastructure

Factors affecting regional latency:
- Geographic distance to endpoints
- Regional infrastructure quality
- Cross-continental routing
- Submarine cable paths
- Network density

Use this panel to:
- Compare regional performance
- Identify continent-specific bottlenecks
- Plan infrastructure improvements
- Set regional SLA targets
panels.title: Average Latency by Continent

panels.description:
Shows the percentage of ICMP ping packets lost per country over the selected time period.

Calculation:
- (1 - received_packets/sent_packets) * 100
- Averaged across all nodes in each country
- Time Range: $__range

Thresholds:
ðŸŸ¢ 0-0.1%: Excellent connectivity
ðŸŸ¡ 0.1-1%: Minor packet loss
ðŸŸ  1-5%: Significant packet loss
ðŸ”´ >5%: Critical packet loss

Higher percentages indicate:
- Network congestion
- Route instability
- Infrastructure issues
- Potential connectivity problems

Note: Countries are sorted by worst to best performance. Empty or missing countries indicate no data or no packet loss.

targets.expr:
sort_desc(
  100 * (
    1 - (
      sum by(country_code) (icmp_ping_packets_received)
      /
      sum by(country_code) (icmp_ping_packets_sent)
    )
  )
  and
  100 * (
    1 - (
      sum by(country_code) (icmp_ping_packets_received)
      /
      sum by(country_code) (icmp_ping_packets_sent)
    )
  ) > 0
)

panels.title: Packet Loss by Country

targets.expr:
avg by(country_code, isp) (last_over_time(icmp_ping_success_ratio{continent=~"$continent",country_code=~"$country",city=~"$city",isp=~"$isp",endpoint=~"$endpoint",ip_address=~"$ip"}[$__range])) 
and on(country_code, isp) 
(count by(country_code, isp) (last_over_time(icmp_ping_latency_avg_ms{continent=~"$continent",country_code=~"$country",city=~"$city",isp=~"$isp",endpoint=~"$endpoint",ip_address=~"$ip"}[$__range])) > 2)
